questions.question_text:
A company is running an image-processing service in the AWS Cloud. Users upload images to an Amazon S3 bucket for processing. When an image is uploaded to the S3 bucket, several microservices that are based on AWS Lambda functions need to perform different processing tasks on the image. Each task's processing must start immediately after an image is uploaded.
Which solution will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It's D because all the lambdas need to start "immediately after an image is uploaded" Which means they all have to start in parallel. This is a classic SNS fan-out pattern.

Selected Answer: D
C is only possible for 5 microservices because you can only have 5 targets per rule. I'm assuming several is more than 5. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eventbridge/latest/userguide/eb-rules-best-practices.html
Correct D.

Selected Answer: C
D doesn't make sense why SNS to invoke Lambda? Lambda can be a target of S3 notification without a need for SNS

Selected Answer: D
Both options C and D would meet the requirements specified in the scenario.

Option C creates an Amazon EventBridge (CloudWatch Events) rule with an event pattern for PutObject events in S3 event notifications. Then, it registers an SQS queue as a target for the rule and invokes the microservice's Lambda function from the SQS queue. This approach allows each microservice to start processing the image immediately after it is uploaded, as the S3 event triggers the EventBridge rule, which in turn triggers the Lambda function by adding the event to the SQS queue.

Option D creates an S3 event notification with an Amazon SNS topic as the destination. Each microservice's Lambda function is subscribed to the topic, allowing each microservice to start processing the image immediately after it is uploaded, as the S3 event triggers the SNS topic and each subscribed Lambda function.

Both C and D option are valid solutions, but D is less complex but it's less flexible, since it will invoke all the Lambda function for all the images.

A review reveals that the retraining has failed multiple nights in a row without the company noticing the failure. A solutions architect needs to improve the workflow so that notifications are sent for all types of failures in the retraining process.
Which combination of steps should the solutions architect take to meet these requirements? (Choose three.)
